Silver also climbed significantly. Global markets mirrored this trend, with spot gold nearing record highs. Investors are seeking stability as the US Fed signals a cautious approach to interest rates.

title: TCS layoffs: HR chief clarifies; ‘We are not chasing a target’
description: Tata Consultancy Services HR head Sudeep Kunnumal addressed layoff concerns. He clarified that TCS is not targeting job cuts but will evaluate all employees. The company has seen a 1% workforce reduction, with further evaluations planned for those who cannot be redeployed. Kunnumal also mentioned TCS's localized US workforce and adaptability to H-1B visa rule changes.

Both nations are keen to boost bilateral trade significantly.

title: How 5 minutes of daily exercise can improve circulation and protect your heart
description: New research reveals that even five minutes of daily exercise can significantly lower blood pressure. A study found that replacing sedentary time with brief, intense activities like running or cycling reduced both systolic and diastolic readings. These small, consistent increases in movement are crucial for improving cardiovascular health and managing hypertension.

title: Indian-origin US adviser held: Why he’s under scrutiny; what FBI found at his home
description: An Indian-origin scholar, identified as Tellis, has been detained by US authorities on charges of unlawfully retaining over 1,000 pages of classified national defense information. The documents, marked "SECRET" and "TOP SECRET," were discovered at his Virginia home. Authorities also allege Tellis met with Chinese officials multiple times.

Allies like Upendra Kushwaha and Jitan Ram Manjhi express dissatisfaction, with HAM even announcing plans to contest against Chirag Paswan's LJP. BJP leaders maintain alliance strength, while the opposition Mahagathbandhan criticizes the BJP's intentions.

Sultan of Johor Cup: After no handshakes in cricket, India, Pak exchange high 5s - watch video
description: Indian junior hockey players showcased sportsmanship, exchanging greetings with Pakistani counterparts at the Sultan of Johor Cup, a stark contrast to recent cricket team "no handshake" incidents. Despite political tensions, the U-21 hockey teams shared high fives, highlighting a different spirit. The hockey match itself was a thrilling 3-3 draw, with India maintaining their unbeaten streak.

title: Salman Khan never made Govinda feel inferior, recalls Deepshikha Nagpal: ‘Govinda would correct him, he would listen respectfully’
Jaisalmer bus tragedy: How vehicle bought 5 days ago became death trap
description: A private bus, recently converted to AC, erupted in flames near Jaisalmer, claiming 20 lives, including three children. A suspected short circuit in the AC system caused the rapid spread of fire, trapping passengers. Rescue efforts were hampered by intense heat. Investigations into the bus operator and modification are underway.

title: ‘Brics was an attack on dollar’: Trump explains why he imposed tariffs
description: US President Donald Trump has renewed his tariff threats against Brics, alleging the bloc is "against the dollar" and claiming nations are withdrawing. India, meanwhile, advocates for multilateralism, potentially creating friction with the US. Trump views BRICS' expansion as a direct threat to the dollar's global standing, vowing hefty tariffs on member nations.

title: US revokes visas of 6 foreigners for Charlie Kirk murder 'celebration'
description: The US State Department revoked visas for six foreigners from Argentina, Brazil, Germany, Mexico, Paraguay, and South Africa for celebrating the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, an ally of President Donald Trump. This action follows Kirk's killing on September 10, with the State Department vowing to remove "aliens" who celebrate the death of Americans and take advantage of US hospitality.

title: Karisma Kapoor’s kids question Sunjay Kapur’s father’s will over gender error
description: New claims emerged in the Delhi High Court regarding the inheritance of Sunjay Kapur. Karisma Kapoor's children are questioning the validity of their father's will. Senior Advocate Mahesh Jethmalani highlighted inconsistencies, including the use of feminine pronouns for Sunjay Kapur. The court also heard arguments about the will's origin and alleged control over the estate.

title: Illegally kept secret docs, met Chinese officials: Indian-origin US expert arrested — what we know
description: An Indian-origin Pentagon contractor and State Department adviser, Ashley Tellis, faces charges for allegedly removing classified Air Force documents. Court records reveal Tellis met extensively with Chinese government officials, discussing sensitive topics like emerging technologies. He is charged with unlawful retention of national defense information, a serious offense with potential prison time and fines.

title: Watch: Video of man begging inside Bengaluru metro goes viral
description: A video of a man begging inside a Namma Metro train has gone viral, showing him soliciting money in the last coach. Metro authorities confirmed that begging is strictly prohibited on their premises and stated that security personnel monitor such activities.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor’s WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho’s Arattai
description: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right, dismissing a doctor's petition to restore her blocked account. The court suggested using alternative apps like Zoho's Arattai, emphasizing users must comply with private platform policies.
